items.title: West Nile virus activity detected in Solano County
items.summary: The Solano County Department of Health and Social Services, Public Health division, the Davis Arbovirus Research and Training (DART) laboratory and the Solano County Mosquito Abatement District (SCMAD) have confirmed that two mosquito pools have tested positive for West Nile virus (WNV). The specimen samples were collected July 30, 2021 in southern Davis, Solano County. As of July 30, 2021, although we have not seen human cases in Solano County, the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) reports that 4 human cases from 4 counties across the state have tested positive for West Nile Virus.
